sections.normalizedDoc_:
## Introduction

AMP HTML files don't support the normal HTML `img` tag. With [`amp-img`](/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-img-vundefined.md) AMP provides a powerful replacement.

sections.doc_: `amp-img` is a built-in element and is automatically imported via the AMP runtime.
sections.normalizedDoc_: `amp-img` is a built-in element and is automatically imported via the AMP runtime.

sections.doc_: You can use the `amp-bind` extension for dynamically changing an image.
sections.normalizedDoc_: You can use the `amp-bind` extension for dynamically changing an image.

sections.code:
<style amp4email-boilerplate>body{visibility:hidden}</style>
<style amp-custom>
amp-img > div[fallback] {
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  background: #f2f2f2;
  border: solid 1px #ccc;
}
.inner{
  flex-basis: 0;
  -ms-flex-preferred-size: 0;
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -ms-flex-positive: 1;
  flex-grow: 1;
}
.outer {
  width: 320px;
  height: 320px;
  background: red;
  display: flex;
  flex-wrap: wrap;
  -webkit-box-align: center;
  -ms-flex-align: center;
  align-items: center;
}
</style>
</head>
<body>

sections.doc_: A simple [responsive](/amp-dev/documentation/guides-and-tutorials/develop/style_and_layout/control_layout.md) image - *width* and *height* are used to determine the aspect ratio. Use `alt` to specify text that can act as an alternative for the image.
sections.normalizedDoc_: A simple [responsive](/amp-dev/documentation/guides-and-tutorials/develop/style_and_layout/control_layout.md) image - *width* and *height* are used to determine the aspect ratio. Use `alt` to specify text that can act as an alternative for the image.

sections.doc_: [tip type="default"] HTML 5.1 provides guidance for creating text to act as an alternative for images. [/tip]
sections.normalizedDoc_: [tip type="default"] HTML 5.1 provides guidance for creating text to act as an alternative for images. [/tip]

sections.doc_: `amp-img` supports AMP's [common attributes](/amp-dev/documentation/guides-and-tutorials/learn/common_attributes.md#fallback), which means you can show a `fallback` in case the image couldn't be loaded. This is great for adding offline support to your AMPs.
sections.normalizedDoc_: `amp-img` supports AMP's [common attributes](/amp-dev/documentation/guides-and-tutorials/learn/common_attributes.md#fallback), which means you can show a `fallback` in case the image couldn't be loaded. This is great for adding offline support to your AMPs.

sections.doc_: If you want to ensure that users with JavaScript disabled can see your images, you can add an additional `img` element inside a `noscript` tag. This also makes it possible for webcrawlers without JavaScript runtime to discover your images.
sections.normalizedDoc_: If you want to ensure that users with JavaScript disabled can see your images, you can add an additional `img` element inside a `noscript` tag. This also makes it possible for webcrawlers without JavaScript runtime to discover your images.

sections.doc_: Use the [`noloading`](/amp-dev/documentation/guides-and-tutorials/learn/common_attributes.md#noloading) attribute to hide the loading indicators on page load. This is recommended for logos and small images/icons.
sections.code:
<amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/amp_by_example_logo.svg"
  width="208"
  height="40"
  alt="AMP by Example"
  noloading></amp-img>
